fields.headline: Give it a try
fields.bodyText: Blair and Ahern urge IRA action (June 28), but in British and Irish law groups do not rob banks; people rob banks. Can Messrs Blair and Ahern explain how the IRA might legally police the undertaking they demand, that its members refrain from what you so quaintly describe as "quasi-military activity that turns to criminal acts"? What we are really witnessing since last December is a deliberate stall in the peace process to prevent Ian Paisley becoming first minister of Northern Ireland with Gerry Adams as his No 2. I think they should try it. Paddy McGarvey Irish Parliament Trust
